p: The PIDIRAC (Pla d’Informació de les Infeccions Respiratòries Agudes a Catalunya) sentinel surveillance system [ 15] is constituted of general practitioners and pediatricians from 40–44 primary care centers distributed throughout Catalonia. The mean number of general practitioners involved during the study period was 32 (ranging from 27 to 35) and the mean number of pediatricians was 26 (ranging from 24 to 28). The mean percentage of the population surveyed was 0.97% (ranging from 0.86 to 1.06).
